tit.e: Jinjakakuroku (historical investigation book of old shrines"

sen.j: 神社覈録（じんじゃかくろく）は式内社を始めとする古社を考証した書物である。
sen.e: Jinjakakuroku is the book of historical investigation of ancient temples and shrines, such as Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws).
Jinjakakuroku is the book of historical investigation of ancient temples and shrines, such as Shikinai-sha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws).
Jinjakakuroku is the book of historical investigation of ancient temples and shrines, such as Shikinai-sha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws).
The book, consisting of 75 volumes, was written by Tsuratane SUZUKA.
The book, consisting of 75 volumes, was written by Tsuratane SUZUKA.
The book, consisting of 75 volumes, was written by Tsuratane SUZUKA.

sen.j: 天保7年（1836年）に起稿され、明治3年（1870年）に完成した。
sen.e: He began writing in 1836 and completed in 1870.
He began writing in 1836 and finished in 1870.
He began writing in 1836 and finished in 1870.

sen.j: 体裁は、式内社や国史見在社、その他著名な神社を、六国史を始めとする諸書から各神社に関係する記述を引用しながら、社名の訓み・祭神・鎮座地等を考証している。
sen.e: It took the form of studying historical evidence of Shikinai-sha, Kokushigenzaisha and other prominent shrines in terms of the way of reading the names of such shrines, the enshrined deities and the places of enshrinement by quoting the descriptions about each shrine from the various books, such as Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It took the form of studying historical evidence of Shikinai-sha, Kokushigenzaisha and other prominent shrines in terms of the way of reading the names of such shrines, the enshrined deities and the places of enshrinement by quoting the descriptions about each shrine from the various books, such as Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories).

It took the form of studying historical evidence of Shikinai-sha, Kokushigenzaisha and other prominent shrines in terms of the way of reading the names of such shrines, the enshrined deities and the places of enshrinement by quoting the descriptions about each shrine from the various books, such as Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories).

sen.j: しかし、当時の状況から引用諸書の中に偽書とされるものも混じるなどの問題がある。
sen.e: As a result of the then circumstances, however, it had problems such as misquotations caused by forgeries included in the quoted books.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result of the circumstances at the time, however, it had problems such as misquotations caused by forgeries included in the quoted books.
As a result of the circumstances at the time, however, it had problems such as misquotations caused by forgeries included in the quoted books.

sen.j: また、後日を期して空欄とした箇所も見られる。
sen.e: It is also found that some parts were left blank to be filled afterwards.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also found that some parts were left blank to be filled in afterwards.
It is also found that some parts were left blank to be filled in afterwards.

sen.j: しかし、知られていた限りの『国内神名帳』の全文を参考として掲げるなど、類書中では最も要領を得たものと評価されていた。
sen.e: However, it was highly evaluated as the most pointed among the similar books partly because it contained the text of "Kokunai Jinmyocho" (Official registers of kami and shrines) as fully as possible as a reference.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it was highly praised as the most pointed among similar books partly because it contained the text of "Kokunai Jinmyocho" (Official registers of kami and shrines) as fully as possible as a reference.

However, it was highly praised as the most pointed among similar books partly because it contained the text of "Kokunai Jinmyocho" (Official registers of kami and shrines) as fully as possible as a reference.

sen.j: 明治維新の後、神祇官より献上の内命が下されたため、稿本に補訂を施して清書本と控本とを作成した。
sen.e: After the Meiji restoration, following the secret instructions of Jingikan (department of worship) to present the book to the emperor, Seichobon (clean copied book) and a duplicated ware prepared as the revised and enlarged edition of the original manuscript.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Meiji restoration, following the secret instructions of Jingikan (department of worship) to present the book to the emperor, a clean copy and a duplicate were prepared as the revised and enlarged edition of the original manuscript.

After the Meiji restoration, following the secret instructions of Jingikan (department of worship) to present the book to the emperor, a clean copy and a duplicate were prepared as the revised and enlarged edition of the original manuscript.

sen.j: 前者を明治3年11月22日に上呈した（現宮内庁書陵部所蔵本）。
sen.e: The Seichobon was presented to the emperor on Nov. 22, 1870. (It is currently stored in Imperial Household Archives.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The copy was presented to the emperor on Nov. 22, 1870 (it is currently stored in Imperial Household Archives).
The Seishobon was presented to the emperor on Nov. 22, 1870. (It is currently stored in Imperial Household Archives.)
sen.cmt: 「前者」は「清書本」をさすので、訳を元に戻しました。Seichobon→Seishobon

sen.j: なお、連胤自身は、上呈の2日前に薨じている。
sen.e: The writer, Tsuratane himself died two days before the presentation.
The writer Tsuratane died two days before the presentation.
The writer Tsuratane died two days before the presentation.

sen.j: 明治35年（1902年）、当時皇典講究所の講師であった井上頼圀と佐伯有義が、鈴鹿家所蔵の矢野玄道による校正本を底本に句読点と訓点を施した。
sen.e: In 1902, Yorikuni INOUE and Ariyoshi SAEKI, both of who were the lecturers of Koten Kokyusho (an research institute for Shinto sect), put punctuation marks and guiding marks beside Chinese characters on the original text proofed by Harumichi YANO, which had been owned by Suzuka family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1902, Yorikuni INOUE and Ariyoshi SAEKI, both of whom were lecturers at Koten Kokyusho (a research institute for Shinto), put punctuation marks and guiding marks beside Chinese characters on the original text proofed by Harumichi YANO, which had been owned by the Suzuka family.

In 1902, Yorikuni INOUE and Ariyoshi SAEKI, both of whom were lecturers at Koten Kokyusho (a research institute for Shinto), put punctuation marks and guiding marks beside Chinese characters on the original text proofed by Harumichi YANO, which had been owned by the Suzuka family.

sen.j: そして洋綴2巻本として同所から刊行した。
sen.e: This edition was published by Koten Kokyusho in the form of two volumes bound in Western style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This edition was published by Koten Kokyusho in the form of two volumes bound in Western style.
This edition was published by Koten Kokyusho in the form of two volumes bound in Western style.
